message: Why did you ignore my edits on the team presentation? We agreed on them last night.
Your edits didn't make sense, and they were redundant. I fixed the slides.
Who do you think you are to decide that? This isn't just your project!
I'm the one who’s going to present it! I have to be comfortable with the content.
Guys, can we just focus on finishing the project? We have a deadline.
Stay out of this, speaker_3! This is between speaker_2 and me!
No, speaker_3 is right. You're making this personal, and it's unproductive.
Unproductive? You changed everything without even telling me. That’s disrespectful!
Disrespectful? What’s disrespectful is wasting the team’s time with unnecessary edits.
Can we please stop arguing and find a solution that works for everyone?
Not until speaker_2 stops acting like they run the show.
I'm just trying to get the best grade. Your edits were going to get us marked down.
That's your opinion. You can't know that for sure.
I’ve presented before. I know what works. You clearly don’t.
Wow, seriously? That’s how you see me?
I can't believe you just went ahead and submitted the project without consulting any of us!
What else was I supposed to do? You guys were taking forever to decide on anything.
Still, you should have waited. We were planning to meet tonight to finalize everything.
Yeah, and then we'd spend another three hours arguing over tiny details. We've been stuck for two weeks already!
That's because we wanted it to be perfect! Now it's just rushed and full of mistakes.
You always blow things out of proportion. It looks fine to me.
"Fine" isn't good enough for a presentation that determines our grade! You jeopardized our entire group.
Maybe if you guys participated more instead of nitpicking, we wouldn’t be in this mess!
We did participate! You just never listened to any of our feedback.
Seriously, you always think you know better than everyone else. This is a teamwork project, remember?
Oh, please! I did all the heavy lifting while you two just criticized everything.
That's not true, and you know it. You didn't even incorporate our research properly.
Our grade is going to reflect this mess, and it's going to affect all of us. What were you thinking?
I was thinking that taking action
Why didn't you tell me you weren't coming to the study group?
I didn't think it was a big deal. We can catch up later.
Not a big deal? We have a presentation tomorrow, and you have all the research.
Well, you could have done some research yourself instead of relying entirely on me.
That’s not fair. We agreed you’d handle the research, and I'd handle the slides.
And I did my part; you didn't even check in with me about the progress.
What was there to check in on? You missed the study session!
Maybe if you weren’t so passive-aggressive about everything, I wouldn't have missed it.
You think I'm passive-aggressive? Maybe if you were more responsible, we wouldn't be in this mess!
Responsible? Don’t lecture me on responsibility when you can’t even manage your own tasks.
At least I show up. You’re the one always bailing last minute.
Maybe I wouldn't bail if you weren't so overbearing and demanding.
Demanding? That's rich coming from someone who can’t stick to a commitment.
You act like I’m the only one who’s ever dropped the ball. Look in the mirror!
Oh, so now it's my
Why did you mess up the presentation slides, Tim? It was clearly your responsibility to get it right.
I didn't mess them up, Sarah! You gave me the wrong info in the first place.
Oh, come on, Tim. Don't try to shift the blame. Everyone saw how unprepared we looked because of you.
Unprepared? We looked unprepared because you couldn't even answer the basic questions.
Guys, seriously? We're in this together. Blaming each other won't help.
Stay out of it, Jess. This is between me and Tim.
Yeah, Jess, mind your own business. Sarah just can't admit her mistakes.
My mistakes? You were the one who was supposed to finalize everything. How could you drop the ball like that?
Maybe if you had double-checked the data like I asked, we wouldn't be in this mess!
Can we please focus on fixing this instead of pointing fingers?
Fixing? There's nothing to fix! The damage is already done. Thanks a lot, Tim.
Oh, so now it's all my fault? Maybe consider how terrible your speech was. That was the real disaster.
At least I delivered a speech, unlike you—stumbling over every slide!
Enough! We
Why didn't you pick up the slack on the group project, Lisa?
Are you serious, Tom? I've been doing more than my share of work!
Can you both stop it? This isn't getting us anywhere.
No, Jenna, this needs to be addressed. Lisa has been slacking off.
I haven't been slacking off! I've balanced my tasks with my other responsibilities. Tom, you're the one who didn't even show up for the last meeting!
I had things to do! But at least I'm honest about my priorities.
Enough! We need to focus on finishing this project, not pointing fingers.
I agree with Jenna. But I refuse to be blamed for something I didn't do.
Fine, you want to focus on solutions? Let's talk about how Lisa can actually contribute instead of making excuses.
How dare you! I've been contributing just as much as you, if not more!
Stop it, both of you! This is childish. We need a plan to move forward.
Fine, Lisa, what exactly have you done for the project?
I gathered all the research and summarized it. Did you even read the document I sent?
Yeah, it was half-baked. I had to redo most of it!
I can't believe you submitted that report without even running it by me first!
You were out of the office, what was I supposed to do? Just sit on it and let the deadline pass?
Yes, if it meant getting it right! There were so many errors, now we look incompetent!
Oh, so it's all my fault now? Convenient how you forget that you were supposed to finish your part days ago!
My part was delayed because you didn't provide the data I needed in time. Don't try to pin this on me!
The data was ready; you didn't even check your email! Maybe if you were more organized we wouldn’t be in this mess.
And maybe if you took responsibility for once, we wouldn't have to deal with fixing such a disaster after the fact!
I'm always the one cleaning up your messes! This isn't any different!
Oh please, everyone knows you just rush through everything without caring about quality!
Rushing? Maybe because you never pull your weight and I end up compensating for your incompetence!
Incompetence? You wouldn't even know what competent work looks like if it hit you in the face!
At least I don’t spend all day criticizing others to hide my own shortcomings!
Criticizing because someone
Alex, you didn't submit our group project on time. Now we're all getting penalized!
Well, maybe if you had contributed more, we wouldn't have been in this mess.
I did a lot of the research! It's not fair to blame me.
Oh really? Because it looks like both Sam and I did most of the actual writing.
That's besides the point. You were supposed to submit it. That was your task.
Maybe we should've all had a more even distribution of responsibilities.
And maybe you should have checked in more often. It's not my fault I didn't get a reminder.
Are you serious right now? You know when deadlines are! Be responsible!
And now our grade is suffering because of your carelessness.
If you both are so perfect, why didn't you submit it yourselves?
Because we TRUSTED you to do your part!
This is ridiculous. I'm not taking the fall for your oversight.
Look, everyone makes mistakes. At least admit there's shared blame here.
Blame? Fine, we all share it. But let's figure out how to not let this happen again.
Agreed. Next time we need more communication and shared checkpoints.
Fine. I'll own
I can't believe you messed up the group project like that!
Oh, so now it's all my fault? What about your unfinished slides?
My slides were almost done! At least I didn't miss half the meetings!
I had work! Not everyone has a free schedule like you.
Hey, both of you, chill. We're all responsible here.
Easy for you to say, you didn't even contribute as much.
I did my part, thank you very much. Maybe you should all learn to communicate better.
Oh great, just pile on why don't you? This isn't helping.
Maybe if we had a leader who knew what they were doing, we wouldn't be in this mess.
So now you're blaming leadership? You didn't even volunteer!
Look, this is pointless. What's done is done. We need to figure out how to salvage this.
Salvage it? We barely have any time left!
Maybe if we stop arguing and actually work on it, we might stand a chance.
Fine, then what do we need to do next?
We need to redo the entire presentation, that's what.
Redo? Are you serious? There's no way we can finish that in time.
Why are you always late to our band practice, Jake?
Oh, come on, Sarah. It's just a few minutes, what's the big deal?
The big deal is that it wastes everyone's time. We can't get anything done if you're not here!
Seriously, Jake. We're trying to get ready for the school talent show, and your tardiness is messing everything up.
You know what? Maybe I wouldn't be late if you guys didn't change the practice schedule every other week!
We changed it because Steve has basketball, and we all agreed on the new time.
Well, apparently not everyone can make it, clearly.
You agreed on it too, Jake. Don't act like this is news to you.
Why don't you all just admit you like blaming me for everything?
We're not blaming you for everything, just for being late consistently.
Yeah, it's not fair to the rest of us who show up on time.
It's not fair to keep changing schedules without considering everyone's situation.
Alright, fine. What schedule works for you, Jake? Let's hear it.
Maybe one that doesn't start right after school when I have detention could work.
Wait, you have detention? Why didn't you say something?
I can't believe you just bailed on the team halfway through the project!
I had something important come up! You always act like you’re the only one with responsibilities.
That's because I am the only one who actually gets anything done around here!
Hey, let’s not forget we all have parts to play. Accusations won’t help us finish this project.
Easy for you to say, you're the one who barely shows up to meetings!
I've been swamped with work too! But at least I'm not making excuses like someone.
Enough with the excuses, all I see is the deadline approaching and no progress!
Maybe if you didn't hog all the tasks, we'd feel more motivated to participate!
Agreed, you always want it done your way and it kills any teamwork spirit.
My way is the only way things get done correctly! Do you want to fail?
No, but I refuse to be treated like a second-class team member.
We need to share the workload equally if we want to see this through.
Fine, but if things go wrong, don’t come crying to me.
If you keep this attitude, it'll definitely go wrong.
Let’s set our egos aside and split the tasks
Why did you take all the credit for our project, Sarah?
I didn't take all the credit, Max. I did most of the work!
That's not true! We both contributed equally.
Really? Because it seemed like I was the one staying up all night to finish it while you were out with your friends.
That's unfair, I had other responsibilities too. And I was the one who collected all the data.
Collecting data is just one part. I had to put it all together, analyze it, and write the report!
You wouldn't even have anything to analyze without my data.
And we wouldn’t have a cohesive report without my analysis. It goes both ways, Max!
Fine, but you didn't have to make it look like I did nothing in front of the professor.
I didn't say you did nothing. I merely pointed out who did the majority of the work.
That's not how it came off. You basically threw me under the bus!
Maybe you feel that way because deep down you know you didn't pull your weight.
That’s low, Sarah. I thought we were supposed to be a team.
A team where one person slacks off isn't much of a team.
I didn’t
You seriously dropped the ball on the project deadline, didn't you?
What are you talking about? I did everything I was supposed to do!
Oh, really? Because I had to scramble to get it finished last minute!
That wasn't my fault. You didn't communicate what needed to be done properly!
Both of you need to calm down. We've got bigger issues. The client is furious.
Furious? Because someone didn't pull their weight, and now we look like idiots!
Stop putting all the blame on me. Maybe if you didn't micromanage every single step, we wouldn't be in this mess.
Arguing is not solving anything. We need a plan to fix this now.
The plan should have been clear from the start. But no, everyone had to do their own thing.
You're impossible to work with, you know that? Always pointing fingers.
Can we focus? We're wasting valuable time and making it worse.
Fine. But this is the last time I'm covering for anyone here.
Covering? You didn't cover for anyone. You just made it harder.
Enough! We need to regroup and present a united front to the client.
Just make sure we don't end up in this situation again,
Why didn't you give me the report on time, if you knew it was urgent?
I told you I was swamped with other tasks; you can't expect me to do everything at once.
That's just an excuse. We all have tasks, but I still managed to submit mine.
Maybe because you didn't take on as much as I did. You always delegate the hard parts to me.
That's not true! You're just looking for someone to blame for your inefficiency.
Inefficiency? Seriously? Coming from someone who spent half the meeting checking their phone?
I was checking for updates related to the project! At least I'm proactive.
Proactive? More like pretending to be busy while others pick up your slack!
If you have such a problem with how I work, why don't you say something to the boss?
Maybe I will! Maybe then everyone will see what a fraud you are.
Go ahead. I'll be glad when people finally see how you can't handle pressure.
And I'll be glad when they see you're nothing but a show-off trying to take credit for everyone else’s hard work.
This is getting us nowhere. If you can't be a team player, maybe you don’t belong here.
Oh, trust me, I'm
I don't get why you keep giving me more work when I'm already buried under a pile of tasks.
Maybe if you managed your time better, you wouldn't be struggling so much.
That's easy for you to say when you're not the one drowning in deadlines.
Well, if you could actually follow instructions properly, you wouldn't have this problem.
Can you both stop? This constant bickering isn't helping anyone.
Why should I listen to you? You're not the one caught between their unrealistic expectations and my workload.
You know what? Maybe you're just not cut out for this project if you can't handle a bit of pressure.
Seriously, can't we just focus on finding a solution instead of pointing fingers?
Of course you'd side with them. You always do.
Are you implying there's some kind of conspiracy against you? That's ridiculous.
Look, we're all on the same team. What's the point of tearing each other apart?
The point is, I'm tired of being the scapegoat every time something goes wrong.
Maybe if you stopped making mistakes, you wouldn’t feel like the scapegoat.
Enough! Can we please try to figure out how to distribute the workload more evenly?
Fine, but don't expect me to just
I can't believe you deleted my part of the presentation, Sarah.
Oh, come on, Mark. Your slides were completely off-topic.
Off-topic?! I spent hours on those!
Yeah, and it didn't contribute anything useful. We need this project to be focused, remember?
Can we calm down here? We're supposed to be a team.
Well, some team we are when Sarah thinks she can just override everyone's work!
Maybe if you actually listened to feedback, this wouldn't be an issue.
Guys, seriously, arguing isn't going to fix the presentation.
You're right, but I can't work with someone who doesn't respect my contribution.
Respect your contribution? You didn't even read the project brief correctly!
We're wasting time. Can we just find a way to incorporate both perspectives?
Why should I compromise when she didn't even ask me before deleting?
Fine, next time I'll ask before saving us all from embarrassment.
Enough! This isn't solving anything. Let's start by outlining what needs to be included and go from there.
Maybe, but I'm not sure I can trust Sarah to be a team player.
Trust works both ways, Mark.
Can we at least agree to communicate better and
I can't believe you threw out my project proposal without even reading it!
I told you, we had no time for extra proposals; the deadline was too close.
That's not an excuse! You should have at least given it a chance!
And waste more time when we were already behind? Be realistic.
Both of you need to calm down. We're all stressed out, but fighting won't help.
Easy for you to say, you didn't have your work dismissed like it was nothing!
Maybe because their proposals actually met the requirements? Did you think of that?
Now that's just uncalled for. We're supposed to be a team.
A team where some members think they're more important than others?
I didn't say that, but if the shoe fits...
Can we please keep this professional? We're getting nowhere with this argument.
How can I be professional when my work isn't respected?
Respect is earned by contributing useful, completed work, not half-baked ideas.
Enough! How about we all take a step back and review the decisions together?
There's nothing to review! My proposal was trashed without a second thought.
Because it didn't align with the project's objectives. Stop taking it so personally.
Why didn't you show up for band practice again, Rick?
Calm down, Sarah. I had other things to do.
Other things? We're supposed to be preparing for the school talent show!
It's not like you couldn't practice without me. I've got my own life.
That's not the point. We all depend on each other. You're letting everyone down!
Maybe if the practice sessions weren't so disorganized, I'd actually want to be there.
Guys, we need to focus. Arguing won't solve anything.
Stay out of this, Mike. Rick needs to understand how serious this is.
I'm just saying, we need to find a solution, not keep yelling.
Fine, what solution? You're all just mad at me!
How about you commit to the schedule we all agreed on?
It’s not that easy for me. You know I have a part-time job and other commitments.
Everyone has commitments, Rick. That’s not an excuse to let your team down.
Oh, right, because your life is so much harder than mine?
This isn't about who has the harder life. We need to figure out how to practice effectively.
Effective practices don’t happen if someone doesn’t show
Why did you change the project proposal without telling any of us?
Because someone had to take charge! The original plan was going nowhere.
You can’t just make decisions for the whole group without consulting us!
Well, if you actually contributed something, maybe I'd consult you!
That’s not fair. We agreed on the original plan together.
And it was a terrible plan! Do you want us to fail this class?
This isn’t about failing. It’s about teamwork, which you clearly don’t understand.
Teamwork? More like dead weight. I had to do something to save our grade.
How do you expect us to trust you now? We might as well be working solo.
Maybe you should be! You’re both dragging me down.
Dragging you down? We’re doing our best. Unlike you, we don’t just take over.
Exactly. A team works together, not against each other.
Fine then, maybe I’ll just do the whole project myself. You two can relax.
That’s not the point! This is supposed to be a collaborative effort.
You know what? If you want to be a dictator, go ahead. But don’t expect us to support you.
Why did you take the last of the office supplies without asking anyone?
I needed them for my project, and no one else seemed to be using them.
That's not the point! We share supplies, and you should have checked with the team first.
Well, maybe if you guys actually managed the inventory better, this wouldn't happen.
Both of you, calm down. We need to find a solution, not fight about it.
I'm tired of always having to deal with the mess you create!
Oh, please, like you're so perfect. At least I get my projects done on time.
This isn't productive. Let's figure out a way to prevent this in the future.
Fine, how about we all have our own supplies and don't touch anyone else's?
That's ridiculous. We shouldn't have to work in silos just because you can't handle a little cooperation.
Nobody is saying that, but maybe we need a better system for tracking who uses what.
That's a start, but it doesn't address the core issue—respecting shared resources.
Respect goes both ways, you know. You could try communicating before blowing up.
Can we agree to create a sign-out sheet for supplies and discuss big projects in team meetings?
Fine
I can't believe you went ahead and submitted the project without telling me, Sarah!
Oh, come on, Mark! You weren't even around to help finish it. I had no choice!
That's because I was working on the data analysis you said you couldn't handle!
Well, maybe if you actually communicated, I wouldn't have to make these decisions on my own!
Communicate? You're the one who disappeared for an entire week without a word!
I had personal stuff going on, alright? You don’t know everything I’m dealing with.
And how am I supposed to know if you don’t tell me, Sarah? We're supposed to be a team!
A team? It feels more like you want to control every single aspect of this project!
Control? I just want things done right! Your last-minute changes almost cost us the client!
Don't you dare put all the blame on me! You're not perfect either. Your analysis had errors, Mark!
Those errors were fixable, unlike your sloppy presentation slides!
Sloppy? At least I know how to make a deadline, Mr. Perfectionist!
Maybe if you spent more time focusing and less time on social media, we'd actually get somewhere!
Oh, so now you're stalking
Why didn't you pass me the ball, Jake? We had a clear shot!
You were too far back, Lisa. I had a better angle. We needed points quickly.
That’s not true! I've made shots from that distance before. You just don’t trust me.
It’s not about trust, it’s about making the right play. Stop taking it so personally.
I am taking it personally because you keep doing this. It's like you think you’re the only one who can score.
Can you both stop fighting? We’re losing because we’re not working together.
Oh great, now you're taking his side too? This is unbelievable.
I’m not taking sides! I just want us to focus and try to win for once!
If Lisa would just stick to her role and stop trying to be the hero, maybe we could.
My role? Are you serious right now? We’re a team; everyone should have a chance.
And you’ve had plenty of chances that you’ve blown.
Enough! Let’s call a timeout and sort this out. We’re losing valuable game time.
This is ridiculous. Maybe sitting on the bench would be better if you both think I’m that useless.
Fine! Maybe then
Why did you take my design sketches, Mark?
I didn't take them, Sarah. You always misplace your stuff and blame me.
Don't lie, Mark. I saw them on your desk this morning.
I had my own sketches on my desk! Stop accusing me of stealing your work.
Hey, what's going on here? Why are you two shouting?
Emily, Mark took my design sketches even though he denies it.
I did not! Sarah just can't keep track of her own things.
Can we calm down for a second? Maybe there's a misunderstanding.
The misunderstanding is that Mark thinks he can just take my work and get away with it.
You're being paranoid. I don't need your sketches. My designs are way better anyway.
There it is, the arrogance. You always think you're better than everyone else.
Both of you need to stop. This isn't helping anyone. Let's figure out what happened.
Fine, but I want my sketches back, and I want to know why Mark took them.
I didn't take them, so stop accusing me. Maybe you should look through your messy desk again.
My desk isn't the problem here. Your dishonesty is.
This is getting us nowhere
I can't believe you just bailed on the group project meeting again, David.
I told you, I had another commitment. It's not like I'm doing nothing.
We all have commitments, but we make time for this because it's important. You can't keep skipping out and expect us to cover for you.
Oh, so now I'm the bad guy? You know the professor assigned us an unrealistic deadline. What do you want me to do about it?
Guys, can we just focus on getting the project done? This arguing isn’t helping anyone.
No, we need to address this. David, you need to start showing up or at least communicate when you can't make it.
And what exactly have you been doing, huh? Don't act like you're the only one contributing here.
At least I'm showing up and putting in the effort. The rest of us are pulling your weight.
You're seriously exaggerating. I said I’d handle the data analysis, and I will.
This is really getting out of hand. David, can you commit to a schedule so we can all plan accordingly?
Fine, but don't expect miracles. This whole setup was doomed from the start.
Oh, come on. The only thing dooming this project is your attitude and lack of participation.
I can't believe you took my design and presented it as your own!
What are you talking about? I made some changes, it became my design.
No, you just tweaked a few things. It's still my idea, and you know it!
Well, if you had spoken up during the meeting, maybe you'd have gotten credit.
I was going to, but you cut me off at every chance!
That's just business. Adapt or get left behind.
You can't just brush it off as "business." It's dishonest!
Maybe if you weren't so naive, you'd understand how things work.
This isn't about being naive; it's about integrity!
Well, it's my name on the project now, so deal with it.
This isn't over. I'll make sure everyone knows the truth.
Go ahead and try. Let's see who they believe.
You're underestimating how much people value honesty.
And you're underestimating how much they value results.
Fine, but don't be surprised when karma catches up with you.
Bring it on. I'm not afraid of your empty threats.
They're not empty threats. You'll see soon enough.
Whatever. I've got more important things
I can't believe you didn't tell me about the deadline change for the project!
I assumed you checked the project board. It's your responsibility too.
Checking the board? Really? You know how busy I've been with the new clients.
And you think I'm just lounging around? We're all busy, don't make excuses.
Excuses? You’re the one who always drops the ball and expects me to pick up the pieces.
That's rich coming from the person who missed two meetings last week.
Missed meetings because I was actually securing deals for the firm. What's your excuse?
At least I am trying to keep everything organized, something you clearly can’t manage.
Organized? Then why is everything always a mess whenever you're in charge?
Maybe if you did your part instead of blaming me for everything, we wouldn’t be in this mess.
Oh, so now it's entirely my fault? That's really convenient for you, isn't it?
Convenient? No, it’s the reality you refuse to see because you think you're above these tasks.
I don't think I'm above anything. I just expect some basic professionalism from my team.
Professionalism? Look who’s talking! The person who doesn't even communicate properly!
Maybe if you weren’t
Why didn't you tell me that you were planning to change the presentation last minute?
Because every time I propose an idea, you shoot it down anyway, so what's the point?
Are you serious right now? As the project leader, I need to be kept in the loop!
Yeah, well maybe if you weren't such a control freak, people wouldn't feel the need to go behind your back!
Hey, both of you need to calm down. This isn't helping us finish the project on time.
No, this is exactly why we're behind schedule! Lack of communication and unilateral decisions!
Unilateral decisions? Oh, you mean like all the ones you make without consulting any of us?
I consult when it's necessary. I don't have time to question every minor detail.
Minor detail? Changing the entire presentation format is a "minor detail" to you?
We need to focus on finding a solution rather than pointing fingers right now.
The solution was clear from the start, and it didn’t involve last-minute changes!
And maybe if you were a little more open to suggestions, we wouldn’t be in this mess!
Look, why don't we just layout what needs to be done and divide the tasks? This argument is wasting even more time.
I can't believe you forgot to submit the group project! How could you be so careless?
Me? You were supposed to remind me! Don't act like you're blameless here.
I shouldn't have to remind you; we're both responsible adults. You should set reminders for yourself.
Oh, like you did such a stellar job? You didn't even finish your part until the last minute!
Guys, this isn't helping. We need to figure out what to do next.
Don't try to play mediator, we all know you barely contributed anything to the project.
That's not fair, you didn't even bother to ask for my input half the time.
Maybe because your input was always last-minute and half-baked.
Exactly, we couldn't rely on you. The project failed because of both of your incompetence.
My incompetence? I've been dealing with both of your egos the entire time!
Oh please, like you're any better. This whole project has been a disaster because we didn't work together.
I can't believe you still don't see your own mistakes. This is unbelievable.
We don't have time for this blame game! We need to come up with a solution, not tear each other apart.
The solution is simple: we need to communicate
You always hog the lab equipment, Sarah. It's impossible to get any of my project done!
Oh really, Tom? Maybe if you actually showed up on time for our scheduled slots, you'd get a chance to use it!
I've had to cover for you in other classes, Sarah. It's not like you're always so reliable.
That's completely unfair. I'm dedicated to this group project, more than I can say for you.
Dedicated? You didn't even submit the last batch of data on time, and now we're behind!
Because I had to redo the experiments you botched. Your measurements were all over the place!
Oh, so now it's my fault? Maybe if you shared your methods, we could have cross-checked!
I would share more if you bothered to communicate instead of running off on your own tangents.
You know what, Sarah? I've had enough of this. Maybe we should talk to Professor Allen about splitting the project.
Fine by me, Tom! At least this way, I won't have to deal with your disorganization dragging me down.
And I won't have to deal with your condescending attitude. Good luck handling everything yourself!
Likewise, Tom. Don't expect me to bail you out when you can't manage on your own.
I can't believe you took the lead on the project without even discussing it with us, Chris.
Oh, come on, Alex! I got tired of waiting for you all to make a decision; someone had to step up.
Step up? More like step all over us. We had a plan, and you just disregarded it.
The plan was going nowhere, Maria! We were running out of time.
